main event: Two bright yellow objects, round and about 3 feet in diameter, were observed over Huntington Station, Long Island, New York on February 25, 1954.
interesting points: The objects were observed by two witnesses from Grumman Aircraft Corporation for a period of 40 seconds to 1 minute.
The objects seemed to maintain the same direction and distance for approximately 30 seconds before disappearing.
Another witness sighted similar objects earlier that day but failed to maintain visual contact.
The weather at the time of the sighting was broken overcast with slight visibility.
The report also includes an unrelated sighting of a high-speed object traveling west that exploded with a loud noise and bright flash in the North Atlantic.
sighted object: two bright yellow objects, round and about 3 feet in diameter
location: Huntington Station, Long Island, New York
witnesses: two employees of Grumman Aircraft Corporation
